course.title: Literary Theory and Criticism in the Middle Ages: Seminar
course.description: Examines literary theory and criticism inside curriculum (trivium) and outside (oral culture); manuscripts and commentary tradition; biblical exegesis; arts of poetry, letter-writing, preaching; Platonic and Aristotelian traditions; allegory/allegoresis; sign theory. Includes Augustine, Snorri, Dante, Boccaccio.
course.notes: Knowledge of Latin not required. Qualified undergraduates welcome.
